displayName.text: P&T Knitwear Bookstore, Coffee, & Podcast Studio

formattedAddress: 180 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA

authorAttributions.displayName: P&T Knitwear Bookstore, Coffee, & Podcast Studio

adrFormatAddress: 180 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text: P&T Knitwear is a fabulous bookstore/cafe/event space/podcast studio with a great vibe and an interesting back story. The atmosphere is industrial but warm, with an awesome collection of books across all ages, genres and price ranges. Bargains abound, and I love their giftware! It's an incredibly chill place to hang, with cafe and amphitheater-style seating and delicious coffees and treats to purchase. The staff is knowledgeable and professional and is ready to assist or give you space to explore on your own. Highly recommend for readers of all ages!

originalText.text: Everything you expect in a good ny bookstore. I went to one of their read and sip events. There plenty of space to relax and read. The staff was so kind and thereâ€™s an excellent selection of lit fiction. Also $5 sale books + plenty of newish releases at 30% off

originalText.text:
On a rare venture to the Lower East Side of Manhattan, I discovered a bookstore that was much more than a haven for book lovers. Tucked away in this vibrant neighborhood, this store uniquely houses an amphitheater for events, a feature that sets it apart from your typical bookstore.

I was there to support a friend's event, which gave me the opportunity to experience the store's multifaceted charm. The amphitheater added a communal vibe, transforming the space into a cultural hub where literature and social interaction intertwine beautifully.

What caught me by surprise was the store's delightful offering of seasonal peppermint hot chocolate. This delightful beverage added a cozy touch to my browsing experience, making me curious about what other seasonal drinks they might offer throughout the year. It's these small touches that turn a simple bookstore visit into a memorable experience.

The combination of a well-curated book selection, the unique amphitheater space, and the enticing refreshments makes this bookstore more than just a place to buy books. It's a community center, a place of gathering, and a warm retreat from the bustling city life outside.

I left with not only a deeper appreciation for this part of Manhattan but also with a resolve to return. This bookstore is not just a discovery; it's a place to revisit, to experience the changing seasons, and to see what new events and flavors they will bring next. It's a rare gem in the Lower East Side, offering a unique blend of culture, comfort, and community.

originalText.text: Newish bookstore with a great selection of books, including children's, YA, and an impressive mix of academic and trade. The books are well-organized and the store is comfortable spend time in. There are risers for seating and a cafÃ© in the back. They host a variety of local events, which are worth checking out.
